title: Laracasts - May 19th - Introducing Laravel Homestead
description:
When it comes to local development environments, we have a number of choices. Sure, you can use something like MAMP, but, very quickly, this breaks down. What happens when you want to install Beanstalk? What if you need a special extension? Because "all-in-one" utilities tuck away much of the complexity, these sorts of installations can be difficult to perform.

Here at Laracasts, we're big fans of virtual machines - specifically, with Vagrant. As part of Laravel's mission to assist you from development to deployment, Homestead (a custom Vagrant box) is "Taylor-made" for your Laravel workflow. You'll love it!
